Package at.ac.univie.se2.ws21.team0404.app.database

Interface IDatabase

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    MemoryDatabase, RoomDatabase
    public interface IDatabase
    Interface, used for our database implementation. Allows us to have a test database that does not rely on Room

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

      • addAccount

        void addAccount​(@NonNull
                AppAccount newAccount)
         throws DataExistsException
        Adds the provided account to the database
        Parameters:
        newAccount - the account to be added to the database
        Throws:
        DataExistsException - if an account with the key of {@param newAccount} already exists on the database

      • deleteAccount

        void deleteAccount​(AppAccount account)
            throws DataDoesNotExistException
        Deletes the provided account from the database
        Parameters:
        account - the account to be deleted from the database
        Throws:
        DataDoesNotExistException - if an account with the key of {@param account} does not exist on the database

      • updateAccount

        void updateAccount​(@NonNull
                   AppAccount newAccount)
            throws DataDoesNotExistException
        Updates the given account on the database
        Parameters:
        newAccount - the account, whose id already exists on the database, which will be updated
        Throws:
        DataDoesNotExistException - if an account with the id of newAccount does not exist on the database

      • addTransaction

        void addTransaction​(@NonNull
                    AppAccount owner,
                    @NonNull
                    Transaction newTransaction)
             throws DataExistsException,
                    DataDoesNotExistException
        Adds the provided transaction to the database and assigns owner as its owner/
        Parameters:
        owner - the account to be assigned as owner of newTransaction, cannot be null
        newTransaction - the transaction to be added to the database, cannot be null
        Throws:
        DataExistsException - if a transaction with the id of newTransaction and the owner owner already exists on the database
        DataDoesNotExistException - if owner does not exist on the databse

      • addCategory

        void addCategory​(@NonNull
                 Category newCategory)
          throws DataExistsException
        Adds the provided category to the database
        Parameters:
        newCategory - the category to be inserted to the database, cannot be null
        Throws:
        DataExistsException - if the provided category already exists on the database

      • updateCategory

        void updateCategory​(@NonNull
                    Category newCategory)
             throws DataDoesNotExistException,
                    DataExistsException
        Updates the given category on the database
        Parameters:
        newCategory - the category to be updated on the database, cannot be null
        Throws:
        DataDoesNotExistException - if a category with the id of the passed category does not exist on the database
        DataExistsException - if a category with the name of the new category already exists on the database

      • updateTransaction

        void updateTransaction​(@NonNull
                       AppAccount owner,
                       @NonNull
                       java.util.UUID oldId,
                       @NonNull
                       Transaction updatedTransaction)
                throws DataDoesNotExistException
        Updates the transaction with the id in oldId and owner owner to the value passed in newTransaction
        Parameters:
        owner - the owner of the transaction to be updated, cannot be null
        oldId - the id of the transaction to be updated, cannot be null
        updatedTransaction - the transaction, which will be inserted inplace of the old transaction
        Throws:
        DataDoesNotExistException - if an account owner or a transaction with owner oldId pair does not exist on the database

      • deleteTransaction

        void deleteTransaction​(@NonNull
                       AppAccount owner,
                       @NonNull
                       java.util.UUID idToBeDeleted)
                throws DataDoesNotExistException
        Deletes the transaction with the given id idToBeDeleted and owner owner from the database
        Parameters:
        owner - the owner of the transaction to be deleted, cannot be null
        idToBeDeleted - the id of the transaction to be deleted, cannot be null
        Throws:
        DataDoesNotExistException - if the owner owner or the idToBeDeleted does not exist on the database
